content.label: Love Threes, but with the latest update being pushed into Gamecenter automatically. Please remove this sticky behavior, it's very annoying.

This game has been on my phone nearly since release and I still enjoy it.  The mechanics are extremely simple but have that timeless quality that make gameplay interesting.

I‚Äôm writing this review now since I noticed the first update in a long time.  I was disappointed though that the update didn‚Äôt include better hints about what and where the next piece will be.  I agree with other reviewers that the hints are insufficient for skilled players, making dumb luck too large of a factor, especially in the complex endgame.  Optional features to show the exact next piece and where it will land certainly won‚Äôt make the game too easy!
Threes is the perfect blend of zen, cute and challenging, I have been playing since 2014 and disappointedly have still not seen the win screen.

title.label: Greatest Mobile Game of All Time

content.label:
I just realized that after my hours and hours in this game I should leave a review. This is the perfect mobile game, both in its simplicity and feel ‚Äî making it easy to jump in to a game while you‚Äôre idle ‚Äî to its surprising depth of strategy that can be entirely captivating. 

The only thing I don‚Äôt like is when the ‚Äúup next‚Äù is three different numbers, which feels like you‚Äôre too much at the whims of luck (although maybe it would be too easy otherwise). And that when coming from multitasking or unlock the app sometimes makes a move for me; I usually pause the game before I leave the screen just in case. 

Great stuff! Best money I‚Äôve spent on a game to date.
I love this game so much, but it annoys me every single time I use it that it doesn‚Äôt switch its color theme automatically based on my device settings

I‚Äôve been playing this game for years and still can‚Äôt get to the highest tile ü§£ and yet I‚Äôm still playing and still enjoy it. 

It may not be the most intellectually challenging or stimulating game out there, but it certainly is calming (for those complaining about ‚Äúbaby voices‚Äù just turn off the sound - haven‚Äôt had mine on in years). It‚Äôs my favorite way to wind down at the end of the day. Engaging enough to preoccupy my otherwise noisy mind, yet not too stimulating to prevent me from relaxing.

My high card is 1536 and I find this game more awesome than 2048, even though I have gotten 4096 in 2048! Threes is enjoyable to the max!

‚Ä¶Oh, and this is where I got "volleo6144" from.
Seriously the greatest game ever made!!!

It's amazing. There have been times when I have not been able to put it down and YEARS after having  purchased it, I still find myself playing it.

Simply one of the best iOS games I've ever played and it's insane you don't already own it.

Really happy to see an update after all this time, fearing it had been abandoned by the developer. I have played this game nearly every day since it was released (5 yrs ago?). I would love to see further development, as there are still areas for improvement, but this is the only mainstay for me as other games come and go (including console and PC)

I‚Äôve had Threes since a little while after it launched and it‚Äôs still perfect in its execution. Some tense COVID nights and there is nothing more captivating and simultaneously relaxing than this game. It‚Äôs quirky and delightful in so many ways. I love the characters behind each of the tiles and the general esthetic. Thanks for keeping the application alive.

Love this game!   I use it to chill out.  I can think about other things as My brain responds to the always-changing numbers.
May we please have an ‚Äúundo‚Äù option ?  My cat has bumped my arm many times ruining an otherwise great score.  Another feature that would be delightful is a ‚Äúgame replay‚Äù so I can review my skill or lack thereof.  Thanks for a terrific companion.

I started playing this game whenever it first came out. I‚Äôve played over 14,000 games with my high score happening during The Great Quarn. It‚Äôs consistently challenging and if I don‚Äôt pay attention I end pretty early. I cannot express how happy I am that Threes was ready for update so close to iOS 14 day!!!!!
I have hundreds of hours on this game, more than any other in my life.

I bought this app a number of years ago and it continues to be some of the most fun you can possibly have on your phone. The development team is great and is always making improvements to keep the game functioning perfectly!
I always play it to calm down or pass the time. Very relaxing.

I usually play a game for a few weeks then forget about. Threes has been a staple of mine for years. On public transportation, waiting for someone, one last game before bed. Simple gameplay but truly addictive.
On the new iPhone the screen is often swiped out of full view as numbers are moved down. This leads to missed or incorrect moves. It is very irritating.

Love the game, it‚Äôs a blast to play especially if you‚Äôre into brain teasing games however it has a huge operational issue. 

Part of the game involves swiping the screen up, down, left, and right. On a new iPhone that has no home button if you swipe up to go home it will also swipe your game up essentially moving the tiles against your will. This has essentially destroyed my strategy unless I play a game start to finish without doing anything else on my phone.

My go to game on iPhone and iPad, been playing it for years and it‚Äôs still as entertaining!

Would love to see an update that makes it works with the new Magic Keyboard using the arrow keys!

They had some nerve charging six bucks for this crap!  At least it‚Äôs now 99 cents, but it‚Äôs still way too much for this atrocious game!  Annoying sound effects, ridiculous rules that make no sense, and it constantly dishes out 1s and 2s when you start doing well, which quickly ends gameplay!  

2048 was inspired by this.   It‚Äôs VERY rare that a knock-off game is actually better than the game that inspired it, but this is the case here!  This game cheats and is so irritating with the voices, that I always end up playing a few games, then going on to a better game! 

Get 2048, delete this garbage!  Threes may have inspired 2048, but is nowhere NEAR as good!  I‚Äôm just SO grateful I didn‚Äôt buy this when it was $5.99!!  Even at $.99, it‚Äôs still much too expensive for this P.O.S.!!! üò°üò°
I have been playing this for so long and love every minute of it. Never get tired of that 6144
Purchased this around 2014, many games come and go in my phone and iPad but this remains, and still I am yet to solve the game. Truly a Classic Game.

title.label: A game I love to hate

content.label: It‚Äôs a game that causes all other things to fall away.  I love it.  I hate how much I need it.  Worth every cent, and worth every subsequent download after I have vowed to quit the game for real this time, time and time again. ü§£

title.label: Automatically swipes up when I come back from multitasking please fix!!!

content.label: If I‚Äôm playing Threes and switch to Spotify to change the song, it‚Äôll swipe up on its own when I go back. It‚Äôs so frustrating and makes me lose like right after :(

title.label: If you like 2048, don‚Äôt get this

content.label: I cannot believe I paid $5.99 for this when other said it was free. Played for 10 min. There‚Äôs no end in site. The addition is clumsy. Buyers remorse.

It would be fun to build up some value you to allow the collection of themes or different colors to change the screen a bit.

I love the game, and everything it is about. I play it quite a bit, I just wish I could change the visuals slightly to keep it from feeling monotonous

title.label: Great fun casual game- just one thing...

content.label:
A brilliantly simple, takes a minute to learn and longer to master, intuitive game.

The only thing that is counter intuitive is the ‚Äúreplay‚Äù button at the end of the game appears in the top left of the screen. I know this is an older game designed when larger phone screens weren‚Äôt as common. It‚Äôs wishful thinking perhaps that something like this could be changed in an update, but moving the play again option to the bottom center after a game ends rather than the current ‚Äúsee scores‚Äù option just makes sense. Especially with a one handed game like this. 

Thanks!
Wish there was a setting to have it follow the system light/dark theme instead of changing it manually

title.label: Have to restart iPad to get Threes to work

content.label: Pretty clever game.  The implementation is frustrating in that it doesn‚Äôt work unless I restart my iPad.  O/w a 4 or 5 star review.  First game and game purchase from the App Storefor me.  Disappointing.
‚Äònuff said.
I‚Äôm still addicted after many years, still seeking that elusive last tile.

Been playing Threes for years and love it. 

Only problem is with the new swipe gestures on iPhone, occasionally swiping between apps triggers an unwanted move in Threes when you return. Many a game has been spoiled by this.
Used to be fun, now it‚Äôs constant crashes, and weird bugs. Like making moves without input. Please update.

I‚Äôve been playing this game for five years. It is profoundly simple yet incredibly deep. It requires mental juggling and zen-like focus. It really never gets old and changes as you get better yourself.

This is a pleasant swiping game that I play to keep my hands busy while I talk to people. It did not  take long before I felt like I could no longer improve my gameplay. The gameplay mechanics just seem slightly too unsophisticated to be able to effectively control the outcomes on such a small playing board. It's frustrating to play very well for a long time and then get a bad draw and have to start over. But the gameplay loop is reasonably enjoyable.
It‚Äôs just a good game. It‚Äôs not gambling like candy crush. There‚Äôs still random but you can win it
Leaving and returning to the app will result in a random move without your input. It‚Äôs been like this for many months.
If you ever update the game can make it so you can start a new game without having to invoke Reachability or use two hands to reach the new game button.

I have had this app for 7 years and played 16,936 games of threes. I don‚Äôt really ‚Äúplay‚Äù the game anymore: I haven‚Äôt earned a high score in years Yet, I open and use it about a hundred times a day.

I‚Äôve played Threes about 3 thousand times and can‚Äôt stop until I merge a 3072 into another 3072 to get a 6144.  About 300 times I‚Äôve come so close scoring 261,033.  Uggh will update when I finally advance from Whalens to Vollero. :)

I have been playing this game for years. I just recently got to the 1536 tile and there are two levels to go. The tiles do seem to stack against you now, but I still love it. This is a game you can pick up and swipe on mindlessly while waiting for appts, during commercials, etc. It is the easiest distraction on my phone to pick up and put down. I don‚Äôt have another third party app that I have played as much as this one. Thanks threes for years of entertainment!
Wut the title says. It‚Äôs a great game, it‚Äôs not a rigged people.
The audio no longer works.  No response to emails

‚ÄúAlright!‚Äù
This is Treycee. So far I have got to 384 and 12 is a good number.

What jerks. Crap merchandising everywhere. I couldn‚Äôt even get through the tutorial without running into a link to the buy page. I paid for this app. I don‚Äôt want to see this crap. I pay to avoid being spammed. Uninstalling and getting my money back. What crap developers. BTW this is a bad business plan. You‚Äôve alienated your customers and have embarrassed yourself with a crap business plan. Death by Merchandizing!!!! LOL! Idiots
Three‚Äôs is the best! For math skills sake, I would love to see variations of this game with other digits! Well done!

The only reason I‚Äôm submitting a review is because of the release notes on the most recent update (v1.3.24). 

‚ÄúWe don‚Äôt feel comfortable interrupting your game experience to ask for a review...‚Äù

You got some awesome devs who truly care about the user experience. I‚Äôm also interested in what your commit messages look like.

I‚Äôm surprised I haven‚Äôt seen anyone else post about this, since it‚Äôs happened to me on my iPhone 7 and now on my iPhone X. 

The game is far from fluid as far as performance. When you have night shift or True Tone on your Display it runs super choppy for some reason, and if you try playing while on a call it‚Äôll also start to run poorly.
